title: Crispy Onions
instructions: Peel the onions down to the first layer of uniformly undamaged flesh then slice them into ¼-inch thick slices.  Separate the onion rings and place them in a large pot and add water until the water level covers the onions.

Place the pot on high heat and bring the water to a boil.  Allow the onions to boil for 5 minutes then remove the pot from the heat and using tongs, or any other useful implement, transfer the onion rings to an ice water bath.  When the temperature of the onion rings allows drain and pat them dry using paper towels.
Set up a deep fryer and after the onions are uniformly dry fry them until they are “very” brown and crisp.  Drain the fried onion on paper towels and keep warm until ready to serve.
remarks: This is a recipe to go with the Natalie Wood and Robert Wagner Beef Stroganoff dish.
source: Natalie Wood and Robert Wagner, Family Recipes for a Russian Dinner by Barbara Wilkins, Bon Appétit, October 1977.
